intro: Besleria lutea var. vulgaris, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow inflorescences. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves with a glossy texture and a strong, spicy aroma. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
